UniProt Entry.description: The amino acid sequence of the current peptide coincides with the part of the UniProt entry that represents a peptide precursor.

Literature.Title: Arminin 1a-C, a novel antimicrobial peptide from ancient metazoan Hydra, shows potent antileukemia activity against drug-sensitive and drug-resistant leukemia cells.
Literature.Author: Liang X, Wang R, Dou W, Zhao L, Zhou L, Zhu J, Wang K , Yan J

Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: Human umbilical vein endothelial cells HUVEC:IC50=61.02 µM,Human embryonic kidney HEK293 cells:IC50=50.58 µM,Human PBMC:IC50=275.4 µM,Human erythrocytes:15% Hemolysis=300 µg/ml
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Human myelogenous leukemia K562/ADM(IC50=14.10µM),Human myelogenous leukemia K562(IC50=17.20µM),Human promyelocytic leukemia HL-60(IC50=11.48µM),Human acute monocytic leukemia THP-1(IC50=17.13µM),Jurkat cancer cells(IC50=32.19µM)
